results.title: Planet ocean
results.brief_description: Tamara Rewse, a self confessed avid stamp collector explores the unknown depths of the ocean, coming across creatures such as sharks, dolphins and manta rays, which co-incidentally can also be found in Australia Post’s Planet Ocean series of stamps. Includes discussion with the stamp’s designer.
results.description: Tamara Rewse, a self confessed avid stamp collector explores the unknown depths of the ocean, coming across creatures such as sharks, dolphins and manta rays, which co-incidentally can also be found in Australia Post’s Planet Ocean series of stamps. results.title: Planet earth: the Hidden earth [B&W]
results.brief_description: Traces the history of studies of the earth’s interior. Explains the significance of volcanic eruptions and earthquakes. Discusses theories regarding the solar system and the changes in the earth’s surface. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Planet earth: science in space
results.creator_credit: WGBH Educational Foundation, Louis de Rochemont Associates and United States. National Aeronautics Space Administration
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Inhabitants of the Planet Earth”.
Traces the development of space research; explains the need for satellites, rockets and other space probes; demonstrates how such tools operate; shows how their findings are reported; and discusses what they have contributed to our knowledge of space and of the solar system. Includes actual scenes of the assembly of instruments, the launching of satellites, and of the operation of tracking stations and computing centres.

results.title: Planet earth: radio waves [B&W]
results.creator_credit: National Academy of Sciences (U.S.) and Lothar Wolff
results.brief_description: Discusses the electromagnetic spectrum, the history of its discovery, the theory and research done on radio waves and the ionosphere which girdles the earth. Explains the ionosphere, how it is explored and used for radio communications, and the new science of radio-astronomy which is probing far beyond our galaxy.

results.title: Planet earth: magnetic force
results.creator_credit: National Academy of Sciences (U.S.) and Lothar Wolff
results.brief_description: Using animation and time-lapse photography this film demonstrates how the geophysicist, using modern instruments, aeroplanes and rockets, studies, measures and maps the earth’s magnetic fields and observes the effects of sun spots and the associated auroras. Includes excellent footage of magnetic storms.
results.creator_credit_for_label: National Academy of Sciences (U.S.) and Lothar Wolff

results.title: Planet earth. Part 1. Secrets of the ice
results.creator_credit: National Academy of Sciences (U.S.) and Lothar Wolff
results.brief_description: The study of glacier ice by scientists in many parts of the world to obtain information on past climate and the changing climate of today, the delicate balance between ice and water on which depends the level of the sea, and how the earth itself was shaped through geological time.

results.title: Planet Earth
results.creator_credit: European Broadcasting Union, Deborah Isaacs, Ian Rosenbloom and Yorkshire Television
results.brief_description: This 4 part series is divided into sections for easy classroom viewing using a combination of the latest computer graphics and filmed examples of climatic occurrences to provide a detailed description and explanation of the geographical factors influencing Planet Earth.
